7381da2e8694.title: Feedback: good article, but I found the title misleading.

paragraphs.text: Feedback: good article, but I found the title misleading. “Should you stay or should you go” makes it sounds like I’m in for an analyses or pros and cons and reasons why you would use Kotlin and reasons why you wouldn’t. Instead, this is basically all pro and shooting down any arguments against it.

a0744f6a80fa.title: That sounds like a great place to work at.

paragraphs.name: 779e
paragraphs.text:
That sounds like a great place to work at. 
That is what it needs, give the team the freedom including tools and languages, and the performance of those teams will outrun those that are restricted. 
We developers are professionals, we don’t need someone to protect the codebase against us. As in the saying: With great power comes great…

Thanks for the feedback. You are right. But I didn’t to write another article why Kotlin is great. I wanted to focus why maybe not but trying to discuss those. 
Hope you still enjoyed it :)

d7d561646a94.title: I understand Kotlin is all the hype now, but I don’t see how investing in a language not supported…

paragraphs.name: cbb5
paragraphs.text: I understand Kotlin is all the hype now, but I don’t see how investing in a language not supported by Google for a long term project is a wise decision. It’s not. It’s very risky. And the fact that not many developers know about Kotlin is another issue. There’s already a shortage of experienced Android developers. So finding developers to maintain a…
